message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.CR 

This paper is primarily focused on person re-identification, which is a task in computer vision. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper proposes a new framework for learning view-invariant features, which involves training deep neural networks. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper uses a bag-of-words model to extract features, which is a common technique in multimedia analysis, suggesting that it may also belong to cs.MM (Multimedia). The paper also involves classification and feature center methods, which are common in artificial intelligence, suggesting that it may also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper deals with video surveillance, which involves security and privacy concerns, suggesting that it may also belong to cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
